chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant David V Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Day Report Center Discharge Notice.
Reviewed by Judge Dorow - filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David V Berry in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.    Penalty enhancer struck by Court upon motion of the State on count 1.    
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2. 
The defendant was sentenced to the following:
COUNT 1:

JAIL:  90 days, STRAIGHT TIME (Credit - 57 days), to commence forthwith.  

DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE: $100 (to be paid as a condition of probation in count 2);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200 (to be paid as a condition of probation in count 2).

COURT COSTS:  WAIVED.

****
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 2.

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

JAIL:  6 MONTHS, Straight time.  (CREDIT - 0 days); consecutive to any sentence if revoked.

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Absolute Sobriety;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  D.B. or G.B. unless they consent and the agent agrees. 
*Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
*Provide a DNA sample if not yet previously done.
*90 Days of Day Report Center, first 30 days with SCRAM.

COURT COSTS:  WAIVED.

DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE: $100 (to be paid as a condition of probation); 

GPS SURCHARGE:  $200 (to be paid as a condition of probation); 

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 60 days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by defendant requesting clarification of court date.  
Court date is 06/11/14 at 3:15 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 11, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant David V Berry in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   
Erik J Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Broughton presented statements to the court.
Requesting a PLEAS date.  
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant David V Berry in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
 Attorney Broughton addresses the bail and presents arguments.  State objects to any bail modification.  Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed. 
  Hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Prior: 2275 S Lombardy Ln, New Berlin, WI 53151

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Comply with the injunction in 13CV27 and no contact with Gayle B. or Daniel B. or their residence.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
